III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms
of intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was hit by Staff 1 while the staff member was attempting
to change bedsheets in the youth's room.
Investigation The complainant was interviewed on 09/25/2023 and no
additional information was provided.
Youth A was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
10/03/2023. Youth A recalled Staff 1 came into her room on the
evening of her first day of placement back at the facility and
removed the bedsheets. Youth A did not provide any more details
or allegations for that specific day.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 10/05/2023 with DHHS Worker 1
during an announced, face-to-face visit to the facility. Staff 1
performed Youth A's intake on 09/20/2023 and recalled that Youth
A was calm with her at that time. Staff 1 stated that once the
intake was completed and Youth A went to her room she began to
become upset. Staff 1 recalled Youth A stating, “If you don’t let me
call my mom, I’m going to say that you hit me.” Staff 1 stated that
Youth A then expressed desire to self-harm for the next half hour
or so. Staff 1 stated she went into Youth A’s room to take the
sheets off of the bed to remove them as a means of self-harm.
Staff 1 recalled Staff 5 came to the entrance of the room behind
her to witness this. Staff 1 recalled the sheets were already on the
floor when she entered the room and that there was no physical
contact between her and Youth A. Staff 1 stated that this whole
interaction only lasted seconds, and that she exited the room
quickly. Staff 1 stated that Youth A never moved and just sat next
to her bed while she did this. Staff 1 stated that some time passed
and Youth A was able to have a phone call. After Youth A
completed the phone call she refused to go back to her bedroom
as instructed. Staff 1 stated that Youth A then sat outside of her
room until about 9:30 PM or so until Youth A eventually went back
into her room.
2

Staff 5 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
10/17/2023. Staff 5 recalled working with Youth A on 09/20/2023
as she was placed back at the facility. She stated that Youth A
was cooperative during the intake process but about an hour later
Youth A began to escalate significantly. Staff 5 recalled asking
Staff 1 to check on Youth A in her room because of the yelling and
crying that could be heard. Staff 5 recalled hearing Youth A yell
outside of her open door that she needed to leave and go to the
hospital. Staff 5 also recalled hearing Youth A refer to her
bedsheets as something she would use to harm herself. Staff 5
then saw Staff 1 enter Youth A’s room and then come back out
with Youth A’s bedsheets in hand and noted that Staff 1 was only
in there for less than 30 seconds. It was clarified that Staff 5 did
not see what occurred in the room. She stated that there were no
noises that indicated any sort of physical contact between Staff 1
and Youth A and that Staff 5 never heard Youth A say anything
until Staff 5 got to the doorway. Youth A then stated that Staff 1
hit her when she came into the room. Staff 5 did not believe this
occurred. Staff 5 noted that she saw no visible injuries to Youth A
at this point in time. Staff 5 stated that Youth A was offered a
phone call which she completed with her mother. After the phone
call Youth A refused to go back to her room and sat in the
hallway. Staff 5 recalled discussing this with Staff 1 and the Chief
Administrator and while Youth A was escalated and verbally
aggressive, they all agreed to continue to attempt to de-escalate
her verbally. Staff 5 noted that after some time Youth A de-
escalated and went back to her room for the end of the night.
Documents reviewed:
• Video footage of 09/20/2023 capturing the interactions
between Youth A, Staff 1 and Staff 5 was reviewed. In the
footage the empty west wing unit hallway can be
seen. Staff 1 walked down the hallway to the last room on
the left. She opened the door and interacted with Youth A,
who cannot be seen while inside her room. After
approximately three minutes of interaction, Staff 1 entered
Youth A’s room. She then exited the room approximately
15 seconds later holding bedding. While this occurred Staff
5 walked down the unit hallway to meet Staff 1. Staff 1
interacted with Youth A for another minute before closing
the door to Youth A’s room, and she and Staff 5 then
walked down the hallway away from the room.
• Internal documentation describing the intake process and
the beginning of Youth A’s placement was reviewed. It
noted that Youth A arrived at the facility at approximately
4:15 pm on 09/20/2023. She completed her intake and no
3

concerns about her behavior or affect were noted. It noted
that after a phone call with her mother at approximately
6:45 am she stated that she needed to leave and go to the
hospital because she didn't want to be at the
facility. Because of comments made about self-harm,
Youth A’s bedding was removed from her room. At the
time of the writing of this documentation it was noted that
Youth A was refusing to go into her room and was telling
staff she was going to physically harm them. Later in the
night it was documented that staff interacted with Youth A
after sleeping hours began. Youth A asked staff if there
was someone that she could speak with, and she further
stated that she was feeling upset and that she was afraid
she might harm herself while placed at the facility. It was
documented further that Youth A stated that she needed to
“get out” of the facility and that she wanted to go to the
hospital to spend her “two weeks there.” It was
documented that Youth A then fell asleep.
Analysis Through interviews of youth and staff, documentation and video
footage reviewed there is not sufficient evidence that any rules
were violated in the interaction and removal of bedding of Youth A
on 09/20/2023.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the
severity of the youth’s behavior, chronological and
developmental age, size, gender, physical condition,
medical condition, psychiatric condition, and personal
history, including any history of trauma, and must be done
in a manner consistent with the youth’s treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was bruised during a restraint by Staff 2 and Staff 3.
Investigation The complainant was interviewed on 09/25/2023 and no
additional information was provided.
Youth A was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
10/03/2023. Youth A was asked to describe what occurred the
next morning after the 09/20/2023 incident. She stated that she
was asked to take her shower and refused to do so. Youth A
described interacting with Staff 1 at this point in time and that Staff
1 was rude to her, but did not have any more details to provide on
what was said to her. Youth A told staff that she would shower so
4

that they would let her out of her room for the morning. Youth A
recalled telling staff she would not shower, as was her original
intent. Youth A then refused to do anything other than stay in the
hallway of the unit. Youth A recalled hitting things on the walls
and yelling at staff. Youth A recalled that she was eventually
restrained and moved from this unit to the other unit across the
building. She believed this was performed by Staff 2 and Staff 3
but was not sure. Youth A stated that she was held from behind
by one of these male staff and that she had trouble breathing, but
she could not recall which staff member that was. She also
recalled being able to get one arm free because she was
attempting to grab on to things as she was moved across the
building. Youth A stated she sat on the floor next to another
bedroom in the opposite unit of the building and continued to yell
at staff. Youth A recalled feeling panicked and throwing up on the
floor at this point. Youth A recalled two staff, who she could not
name, picking her up and moving her into the adjacent
bedroom. Youth A believed that the door was closed on her leg at
that point and that was how she got a bruise on her leg. Youth A
stated that staff were not saying anything to her while she was
restrained or sitting next to her new bedroom.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 10/05/2023 with DHHS Worker 1
during an announced, face-to-face visit to the facility. Staff 1
recalled that she worked the morning of 09/21/2023 and that she
was the staff member responsible for letting the youth out of their
rooms first thing in the morning to use the shower. Staff 1 recalled
opening the door to Youth A’s room, and that Youth A was already
awake and that Youth A remarked “Get the fuck away from me,”
and then proceeded to cuss and use racial slurs at Staff 1. Youth
A was also threatening to punch Staff 1 and the other staff
working that morning, Staff 4. Youth A then left her room, but
refused to shower, pacing up and down the unit hallway and
sitting on the floor, similar to the night before. Staff 1 and Staff 4
stated that they stood outside the door to the hallway of the unit
and supervised Youth A and attempted to de-escalate her. Staff 1
recalled that Youth A broke a hand sanitizer dispenser located on
the wall and that is what caused her to come back into the unit.
Staff 1 stated that there was concern over Youth A's past behavior
as well as her dialogue in that moment that Youth A might attempt
to use that to harm herself. Staff 1 stated that she and Staff 3
came into the unit hallway. Staff 1 recalled that Staff 3 attempted
to start a standing hold restraint, but Youth A immediately fought
this. Staff 1 recalled Staff 3 telling her to not try to get involved
because of the verbal statements Youth A had made to Staff
1. Staff 1 stated that she believed Staff 4 then went into help with
5

restraining Youth A. Staff 1 stated that she walked away from the
situation. The next time she saw Youth A she was sitting on the
floor in a separate unit next to the room that staff use for youth
that are on suicide watch. Overall, Staff 1 stated that she never
saw anyone hit or punch or push Youth A. Staff 1 stated that she
never touched Youth A other than incidental contact very briefly
when Youth A was initially kicking at her and Staff 3. Staff 1 also
did not recall seeing any marks or bruises on Youth A's person.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 10/05/2023 with DHHS Worker 1
during an announced, face-to-face visit to the facility. Staff 2
stated that he did not work the evening of Youth A’s placement at
the facility, but did work the next morning. Staff 2 stated that he
was not involved with Youth A until he saw Staff 3 attempting to
move Youth A from one unit to the other. Staff 2 believed Staff 3
was using a “cradle carry” assist with Youth A. Staff 2 clarified that
he did not see exactly what was occurring. Staff 2 stated that he
became involved when Youth A was sitting outside of her new
room and that Staff 2 tried to talk her into going in, so that she
could be more calm and move on from the situation. Staff 2
recalled that Staff 3 instructed him to put Youth A in a “hook
transport” at that point. Staff 2 stated that this involved him lifting
Youth A up by her left arm and Staff 3 picking her up from her
right arm and they lifted her from a seated position on the floor.
Staff 2 stated that this allowed them to move Youth A right around
the corner into her room, but that Youth A was fighting back and
kicking at them as this occurred. Staff 2 recalled that Youth A was
able to get her hands on the doorway which prevented them from
leaving the room. Staff 2 stated that he was not sure how Youth
A’s hands left the doorway, but eventually they did, and they were
able to set her down and leave the room. Staff 2 stated that, when
this occurred Youth A continued to yell obscenities at any staff
that were present. He stated that he never hit Youth A, pushed
her, and that his interaction with her physically only lasted less
than a minute. He also stated that she did not fall when she was
sat down by him.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 10/05/2023 with DHHS Worker 1
during an announced, face-to-face visit to the facility. Staff 3
stated that he did not work on the evening of 09/20/2023 and did
not interact with Youth A, but did on the morning of 09/21/2023.
Staff 3 stated that he was elsewhere in the building when he
received a call from Staff 1 asking him to come assist with Youth
A. Staff 3 went to the west wing where Youth A was located, and
he stated that Youth A was screaming and yelling in the hallway of
the wing. Staff 3 stated that he then went around the corner to the
6

control room to call the Chief Administrator but as he did so, he
heard Staff 1 remark that Youth A was breaking the hand sanitizer
dispenser off of the wall. Staff 3 stated that because Youth A did
this and because she had been so escalated and threatening staff
and threatening self harm against herself, that this was a situation
they deemed a “crisis to self” and that there was concern that she
might try to break the hand sanitizer dispenser further and use it to
harm herself. Staff 3 stated that the decision was made to move
her to one of the camera rooms in the east wing. Staff 3 recalled
approaching Youth A and telling her that this was what they were
going to do and asking her to come with them, and she
immediately refused. Staff 3 stated that he attempted to use a
standing restraint with Youth A only for her to fight back and hit
him and wiggle away from him. He recalled her stating “You’re
hurting me” at points when he did not even have his hands on her.
Staff 3 stated that he then attempted to use a “cradle carry” to the
other wing. Staff 3 stated that this was successful as Youth A
fought back less until he lost control over one of her arms and she
grabbed a support pull that stands in the middle of the common
area between the two units. Staff 3 recalled that Staff 4 was able
to peel Youth A's fingers off the pole, and that this occurred again
about 10 feet further. Once Youth A let go of the second pole,
Staff 3ert recalled that he was able to move her into the east wing
into the doorway of her new room. Staff 3ert called that Youth A
then put her feet on the doorway of the room and refused to go
inside, so at that point, he decided to set her down and allow her
to sit on the floor outside of the room. Staff 3 recalled that he and
the other staff present, to which he could not exactly recall who, all
tried to de-escalate Youth A verbally. Staff 3 stated that this lasted
for a few more minutes. Staff 3 recalled that Youth A was still
escalated, threatening to hurt herself and staff and cussing and
using racial slurs against certain staff members. He stated that he
called the Chief Administrator and that the Chief Administrator and
he agreed that they could try to safely move her to her room if that
was the only way that she would make it in there. Staff 3 stated
that they tried to de-escalate more after that as a good faith effort
towards Youth A. Staff 3 recalled that Youth A would continuously
say that she would get up and go to her room to then immediately
backtrack and state that she would not, and then continue to be as
escalated as moments prior. Staff 3 recalled telling Staff 2 that it
was time to attempt to pick Youth A up from the ground. Staff 3
stated that he clearly communicated with Youth A what they were
going to do. He and Staff 2 then performed a hook transport with
Staff 3 on her right side and Staff 2 on her left. Staff 3 recalled that
Youth A initially stood up, but then resorted back to fighting,
wiggling, and flailing, making it difficult for them to safely hold her.
7

Staff 3 stated that they quickly got her into the door as Staff 2
entered first and then Staff 3. He then recalled that as they
released Youth A, she was on her feet and as soon as their hands
left her, she charged at them attempting to hit and get past them
to the hallway. Staff 3 stated that he recalled Youth A holding her
hands on the door frame, but then letting go as they closed the
door without issue. He also recalled that Youth A was so
escalated that she was visibly gagging, and he called her
commenting that she was going to throw up, but she never did.
Staff 3 stated that he remembered seeing Youth A standing on her
bed, ripping up the toilet paper in her room at that point. He did
not recall anyone taking the toilet paper away from her at that
point. Staff 3 also did not see any marks or bruises on Youth A at
that point, but he did recall her yelling about being bruised.
Staff 4 was interviewed on 10/05/2023 with DHHS Worker 1
during an announced, face-to-face visit to the facility. Staff 4
stated that she first interacted with Youth A on 09/21/2023 when
Staff 1 was attempting to assist Youth A with taking a shower first
thing in the morning. Staff 4 recalled hearing Youth A yell, racial
slurs at Staff 1 and telling her to shut the fuck up. At that point in
time, Staff 4 recalled that Staff 1 just closed Youth A's door to then
attempt to help another youth shower. At that point Staff 4 recalls
hearing Youth A, said that she actually would comply and take her
shower, and then Staff 1 opened her door to let her out. Youth A
then came out of her room and escalated further and stated that
she would not be showering. Staff 4 recalled attempting to talk to
Youth A to try to de-escalate her. Staff 4 stated that Youth A was
just sitting on the floor of the hallway of the unit at that point.
Youth A then followed Staff 4 and Staff 1 towards the end of the
hallway and stated that she was going to run out of the unit and
continue to escalate further. Staff 4 recalled that Youth A tried to
squeeze her and Staff 1 but she was stopped when Staff 1
attempted to shut the door to the hallway. Staff 4 stated that she
saw Youth A turn around and strike the hand sanitizer dispenser
that was on the wall and try to pull it off to break it. Staff 4 recalled
then switching with Staff 3 so that she could work with the boys
unit and Staff 3 would continue with Youth A. Staff 4 stated that
she had moved some distance away, but she did see Staff 3 open
the hallway door again to interact with Youth A. Staff 4 believed at
that point that Youth A was escalated to the point of being
hysterical and there was great difficulty in helping her calm down,
or reasoning with her. Staff 4 recalled seeing Staff 3 using a
cradle assist to move Youth A from the west wing to the east wing
and crossing through a common area. When Staff 4 saw Youth A
get her hands free and grab onto a support pole to stop the
8

momentum of Staff 3, Staff 4 recalled helping peel Youth A's
hands off the pole. Staff 4 recalled seeing Staff 3 escort Youth A
through the door to the east unit and gently setting her down so
she was then sitting outside of the doorway of the first bedroom in
that unit. Staff 4 recalled attempting to talk to Youth A more to de-
escalate her at this point. Staff 4 also recalled Youth A going
back-and-forth stating that she would go into the room but then
refusing, several times going back-and-forth from being calm to
being further escalated. Staff 4 recalled Staff 3 telling Staff 2 to
assist him with a “two person assist” where Staff 3 and Staff 2
picked Youth A up from her armpits from the sitting position on the
floor. Staff 4 recalled seeing Youth A kicking off the door as Staff 3
and Staff 2 were able to get her inside to then set her down on her
feet. Staff 4 recalled hearing Youth A screaming about her leg but
being confused because no one had their hands on her leg, and it
had not been in any compromising position during the very quick
physical contact. Staff 4 recalled that staff were able to leave
Youth A at that point. She did not believe she ever saw any marks
or bruises on Youth A. She also stated that she never saw any
staff hit or push or strike Youth A in any unsafe or inappropriate
manner.
Documents reviewed:
• Video footage of 09/21/2023 capturing the escalation and
restraint of Youth A was reviewed. The footage starts with
the same view as the day prior of the empty west wing unit
hallway. Youth A was interacting with Staff 4 and Staff 4
left the frame and Youth A appeared to become more and
more upset. Youth A proceeded to hit a hand sanitizer
dispenser on the wall causing the front portion of it to fall
and open up. Youth A then briefly stood against the
opposite wall only to then appear to yell and fall to her
knees. Staff 3 and Staff 1 then entered the hallway and
attempted to restrain Youth A. Staff 3 held Youth A by the
arms behind her and Staff 1 initially attempted to pick up
Youth A’s legs, only to set her back down. The three
individuals then leave the frame and were next seen from a
security camera that captures a common area in between
the east and west units. Staff 3 was seen escorting Youth
A from behind and Youth A was walking under her own
power, with Staff 1 following them from behind. Youth A
then attempted to grab on to a support pole only to have
Staff 3 pull her away. Youth A then grabbed the next
support pole and while still standing had her hand pulled off
by Staff 4. Once that occurs Staff 3 and Youth A then walk
out of frame to the entrance of the east wing of units at the
9

facility. This security camera had an obscured view of the
individuals at that point. Youth A was escorted to her new
room by Staff 3 and Staff 2 was seen closely following, with
Staff 4 standing next to the bedroom door. The end of the
interaction where Youth A was placed in the suicide watch
room was not able to be captured shortly after the end of
this last security footage.
• A police report from the Hampton Township Police
Department dated 10/12/2023 was provided. In it the
reporting officer stated that he came to the facility on
09/21/2023 at 10:51 am after the incidents with Youth A
concluded. The officer interviewed Youth A and Youth A
stated that the night prior Staff 1 had hit her on her left arm
and that same morning Staff 3 had picked her up and
squeezed her tightly.
o Photographs of Youth As right left and right arm
were taken on 09/21/2023 by law enforcement and
small bruising can be seen in both photographs.
o It was confirmed on 10/24/2023 that the county
prosecutor had declined to pursue charges against
any individuals involved in the incidents.
• Internal documentation describing the morning of
09/21/2023 of Youth A’s placement was reviewed. There
are several occasions where Youth A was quoted cussing
at or threatening staff members. At 6:30 am it was noted
that Youth A was offered a shower and she initially refused,
only to then change her mind. Once Youth A left her room
she then sat down and further refused to follow staff
directives for taking a shower. It was described that Youth
A escalated further to the point of threatening to punch staff
and then attempting to destroy property by breaking the
hand sanitizer dispenser.
• An incident report dated 09/21/2023 was reviewed. This
described the series of events that caused staff to decide to
place Youth A in a restraint. It was described that Staff 3
initially attempted a “cradle assist” hold with Youth A, only
for her to struggle to the point where he decided to use a
“cradle carry” hold to move her from one unit to another. It
was described that Staff 3 let Youth A go and allowed her
to sit on the floor once in the other unit and he backed up to
give her space. After time spent attempting to de-escalate
Youth A and her continued escalation it was decided that
Staff 3 and Staff 2 would use a “hook transport” hold to
move Youth A into the new bedroom. Further details in this
incident report are consistent with what was provided in
interviews with youth and staff.
10

• Policy & procedures for the facility tiled “Emergency
Restraint” last dated August 2023 was reviewed. It
described procedures for the attempt of de-escalating youth
prior to the use of physical management. In addition, it
described the point in time where physical management
can occur as when “all other interventions are utilized but
fail to protect the youth or others from unanticipated or
severely aggressive behavior that places the youth or
others at serious threat of violence or injury if no immediate
intervention occurs.”
• Policy & procedures for the facility tiled “Suicide Threats or
Attempts” last dated May 2023 was reviewed. It described
procedures for staff in response to a youth who expresses
thoughts or desire to self harm, including calmly discussing
the circumstances surrounding the thoughts with the youth
as well as inquiring if the youth is willing to make a
commitment to not harm themselves. It also stated that
“physical emergency intervention shall be utilized as
necessary” in response to suicidal behaviors.
Analysis Through interviews of youth and staff, documentation and video
footage reviewed there is not sufficient evidence that any rules
were violated in the physical management of Youth A on
09/21/2023.
Technical Assistance provided:
• Over the course of the evening of 09/20/2023 and in to the
morning of 09/21/2023 there was discussion among staff of
assessing the need for closer supervision of Youth A
because of her statements about the desire to self-
harm. At that point in the night the facility did not have the
use of it’s designated room to serve this purpose and it was
stated in staff interviews that this intervention could be used
to help Youth A the following day. Any intervention to aid in
ensuring the safety of a youth, such as the use of seclusion
or removing personal items from them, would need to be
justified to use in the moment and not be used because it
was justified previously and not available at that time.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms
of intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
11

(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative
references to a youth’s background or appearance
or mental state. Yelling, threats, ridicule, or
humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff 1 made disparaging comments to Youth A.
Investigation The complainant was interviewed on 09/25/2023 and no additional
information was provided.
Youth A was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
10/03/2023. Youth A stated on her first day of the placement Staff
1 said inappropriate things to her. Youth A recalled hearing Staff
1 say that no one cared about her and that if she had anyone that
cared for her, she would not have been in detention. At the time
of making these statements Staff 1 was outside of Youth A’s room
standing in the hallway of the unit. Youth A did not believe that
anyone else would have heard these comments.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 10/05/2023 with DHHS Worker 1
during an announced, face-to-face visit to the facility. Staff 1
stated that she did interact with Youth A on her first day placed
back at the facility, specifically as Youth A was escalating entering
evening hours. Staff 1 recalled standing outside of Youth A’s
room talking to her, attempting to de-escalate her. This is when
Staff 1 decided to enter Youth A’s room to remove her bedsheets
because Youth A was making reference to harming herself with
them. Staff 1 denied stating anything to the effect of no one
caring about Youth A or the reasons for her placement at the
facility.
Staff 5 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
10/17/2023. Staff 5 stated that she was working with Staff 1 on
the evening of 09/20/2023 and saw he entire interaction between
Staff 1 and Youth A. Staff 5 recalled seeing Staff 1 standing
outside of Youth A’s room and then enter briefly to remove the
bedsheets as a safety precaution. Staff 5 stated that she was
able to see and hear all of the interaction in that moment between
Staff 1 and Youth A and that she never heard Staff 1 say anything
disparaging or inappropriate to Youth A.
Analysis Through interviews with youth and staff there was not sufficient
evidence found to show a rule violation involving inappropriate or
disparaging comments made by staff to youth.
Consultation provided:
12

• Multiple staff stated that they are trained to never enter a
youth’s room alone, but this is not located in any specific
facility policy. The facility is advised to have this clearly
written in policies & procedures so that it can be messaged
and trained consistently among staff.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
